ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:16): doesn't have to be 'collapse', but just 'not show'..

6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:22): Ratty_: no v is the opposite of g
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:23): Ratty_: ever wondered why grep -v is not verbose but negative output?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (17:25): grep is already verbose.. it prints the whole line whenever a match occurs.. In fact, I can't think of a way to make it any more verbose
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:26): LeoNerd: well actually it has more historical reasons (g/re/p) ...
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:28): sanso: of course the :v needs a range (:%v ...)
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:28): oh, now You tell me :-)

a4d4f61bb32d7162e1ad6346b17c3e10 (17:29): Please! I'm getting freak trying to turn one VIM behavior off... I've searched on Google for hours, tried to turn off most of the "set" stuff, but it still there...
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:29): vloris: ok than iNvert but well this was more a question to make you think about the -v
12f14b72c1c64723146164dd4fe0b6a9 (17:30): thpo: yeah.. well, it might be not that logical, but well, (almost) everyone is now used to the -v, so you can't change it without breaking too much
a4d4f61bb32d7162e1ad6346b17c3e10 (17:30): sanso: If I paste text (with right button) for example on vimrc file, it'll get all commented and idented!
a4d4f61bb32d7162e1ad6346b17c3e10 (17:30): sanso: I'd like to turn off the "auto coment" behavior....
a4d4f61bb32d7162e1ad6346b17c3e10 (17:31): sanso: I turned off all the indent stuff!

6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:31): vloris: ok lets try it the other way around: why would somebody in the first place use -v which everybody else uses for verbose to invert the result of a command?
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:32): thpo, if You write a tool with an oh-so-un-intuitive name as 'grep', You can do anything :-D
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (17:33): :set paste is very useful inside xterm
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (17:33): and forgetting to go into insert mode can be fun
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:34): just as an aside: there is pastetoggle which I find really useful
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:34): Ratty_, isn't there some smart map-command that sets and unsets paste around mouseclicks?
12f14b72c1c64723146164dd4fe0b6a9 (17:34): especially if there is an accidental :w or so in the text you want to paste...

6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:37): Ratty_: what is this mouse thing you are talking about?
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:37): I do like middle-click pasting and sometimes get annoyed with cindent - so I understand Teolupus well :-)
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (17:37): thpo, ask sqweek he/she should know ;-)
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (17:39): I hear people talking about it quite often; there is said to be a common injury named after this mouse thing
